p: Five of the confirmed cases (1.1%) died. Four of them had ischemic heart disease and hypertension. One patient had diabetes and chronic renal insufficiency. All five patients were over 60 years old and had a history of diabetes or ischemic heart diseases. The case fatality rate increased significantly with age (p=0.001) but not with sex (p=0.68) ( Table 2). Meanwhile, 385/452 (85.18%) recovered. No association was found between age or sex and the recovery rate ( Table 3).
